heisigStory: English counts thin, flat objects, like bed linen and paper, in sheets. The kanji does this with a taskmaster whipping a tree into producing sheets against its will.
koohiiStory1: The taskmaster is a strict bathroom monitor who hands out only one sheet of really rough, splintery toilet paper per person. You can see the wood fibers.
koohiiStory2: This taskmaster is the bathroom nazi: he counts how many sheets of toilet paper and tissue you use, and then tells you what % of a tree you just killed.
myStory: một tờ... .đánh gỗ mỏng thành tờ giấy...
words: counter for flat objects (e.g. sheets of paper)
